title: Cherry Cheesecake Pie (Grandma Marilyn’s recipe)
ingredients: 1 tub (8 oz) frozen cool whip, defrosted (or 1 C real whipped cream, mixed with 5 tsp sugar)
1 can cherry pie filling (or any flavor you want, like strawberry, peach, etc)
instructions: Melt butter for crust in glass pie pan
Add graham cracker crumbs and sugar and mix into butter
Press crust onto bottom and sides of pie pan
Microwave for 1 minute
Cool before filling
In mixing bowl, beat cream cheese, sugar and vanilla til creamy and smooth
Add whipped cream and sour cream (optional) and mix well
Pour into cooled graham cracker crust
Spread cherry pie filling evenly over the pie
Chill until ready to serve

title: Great-Aunt Helen’s Strawberry Pie (Grandma Sprenger’s Aunt Helen)
instructions: Mix a small amount of the cold water with the cornstarch to dissolve it. Then add the jello and remaining water and cook over medium heat until thickened.
Cool til lukewarm, and then add sweetened strawberries
Pour into baked pie shell
Refrigerate overnight or at least 8 hours
Prior to serving, cover with cool whip and a few strawberry slices on top

title: Lemon Cheese Pie (Grandma Sprenger’s recipe)
ingredients: 1 C sugar (separated into ¾ and ¼ cups)
instructions: Combine ¾ C of the sugar, cornstarch, slightly beaten egg yolks, and water in saucepan
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until it comes to a boil
Boil for 1 minute and then remove from heat
Stir in lemon juice and lemon peel
Gradually blend in cream cheese
In mixing bowl, beat egg whites until soft peaks form
Gradually add ¼ C sugar to the egg whites, beating until stiff peaks form
Fold into lemon cheese mixture, and then pour it all into baked pie shell
Chill before eating
*for pie shell, use Grandma Marilyn’s recipe but add ½ tsp grated lemon rind to flour and substitute lemon juice for water

title: Grandma Marilyn’s Pie Crust
instructions: Mix flour and salt together
Cut in butter until pieces are the size of peas
Sprinkle water over, 1 Tbsp at a time, tossing mixture after each addition
Form into a ball (do not kneed much as it will get tough)
Flatten on lightly floured surface and roll into large circle with rolling pin until 1/8 inch thick
*for 2 crusts, double the recipe and form 2 balls in step 4

title: Orange Buttermilk Pie (Grandma Sprenger’s recipe)
instructions: Preheat oven to 450
For the crust, mix flour, orange rind, salt and sugar
Cut in the butter
Add orange juice, and mix to create a stiff dough
Press into bottom and sides of pie pan
For filling, mix sugar, flour and salt
Separate eggs, and beat whites til stiff and set aside
Beat yolks in separate bowl and add to the sugar/flour mixture
Add buttermilk, melted butter and orange juice and mix well
Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites
Pour into pie crust in pie pan
Bake at 450 for 10 min
Lower heat to 350 and bake another 30 min longer
Chill before eating

title: Aunt Lenatte’s Lemon Icebox Pie
ingredients: The juice of 3 lemons (or about 6 TBSP real lemon juice)
Make a vanilla wafer crust, using a graham cracker crust recipe but substituting vanilla wafer crumbs for graham cracker crumbs
Egg whites from the eggs used in the filling
instructions: Preheat oven to 350
Make vanilla wafer crust and set aside
For filling, mix condensed milk, egg yolks and lemon juice together, and set aside
For merengue, beat 2 egg whites to stiff peaks, and add vanilla and powdered sugar to taste
Place filling in crust and top with merengue
Bake for 10 min til merengue is golden
Chill prior to eating

title: Pecan Pie (Grandma Marilyn’s recipe)
instructions: Preheat oven to 375
Combine eggs, syrup and sugar
Add melted butter, salt and vanilla and stir
Add pecans and stir in
Pour into unbaked pie shell
Bake 40 min at 375
*for a corn-free pie, substitute maple syrup for the corn syrup

title: Nanny’s Chocolate Pie (Grandma Sprenger’s mom’s recipe)
ingredients: 1 Big Hershey bar with almonds (or without almonds if you don’t like nuts)
1 graham cracker crust (look at the crust part of the recipe on Grandma Marilyn’s cherry cheesecake pie)
instructions: Melt Hershey bar with water over low heat
Cool VERY well and then fold in whipped cream
Pour into graham cracker crust
Chill and eat!

title: Fresh Apple Cake (Grandma Marilyn’s recipe)
ingredients: 4 C. chopped apples (cored and finely chopped with peel on)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350
Cream butter and sugars with mixer
Add eggs and vanilla and beat well
In separate bowl, mix flour, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt. Stir together well
Pour dry ingredients into wet ingredients and mix (batter will be stiff)
Stir chopped apples into dough (and nuts if desired)
Spread evenly in buttered 9X13 glass cake pan
Bake 15 min at 350 degrees
Then lower heat to 325 and bake 25 min longer

Meanwhile, make sauce by combining all sauce ingredients in a saucepan and cooking over medium heat until slightly thickened. Remove from heat and stir in ½ tsp vanilla. Pour over warm cake and serve warm or cold

title: Pineapple Cake (Grandma Snowbarger’s recipe)
ingredients: ¼ C. cooking oil (or melted butter)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees
Mix flour with baking soda and salt
Add the rest of the cake ingredients and mix just combined
Bake at 350 until light golden (around 30-35 min)
While it cooks, make the icing by mixing all the ingredients
Once cake is done, spread icing evenly on top and place under broiler until coconut turns light brown (watch closely, only takes a couple minutes)
Let cool, cut and serve

title: Banana’s Foster (Grandpa Maurice’s recipe)
ingredients: Melt butter in large frying pan
Add brown sugar and cook until caramelized
Cook until bananas are softened and coated in the sauce
Heat Rum (and optional liqueur) and then pour over bananas
Flambe (light on fire) the rum and let the alcohol burn off
instructions: 5-6 bananas, sliced lengthwise in quarters
½ C butter (1 stick)
1/3 C brown sugar
¼ C cream (optional)
2 Tbsp Banana Liqueur (optional)
¼ C Rum
Vanilla Ice Cream
Melt butter in large frying pan
Add brown sugar and cook until caramelized
Add cream (optional) and bananas
Cook until bananas are softened and coated in the sauce
Heat Rum (and optional liqueur) and then pour over bananas
Flambe (light on fire) the rum and let the alcohol burn off
Serve over vanilla ice cream!

title: Arroz con Leche (Aunt Adriana’s recipe)
instructions: Cook rice in large saucepan with water
Add butter and whole cinnamon sticks
When the rice is cooked, add whole milk, condensed milk, la lechera milk and ground cinnamon to rice in the large saucepan;
Stir to combine, and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the mixture thickens, about 15 minutes
Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the vanilla. Serve warm

title: Holiday Jello Dessert (Grandma Marilyn’s recipe)
instructions: Dissolve the cherry jello in 1 C boiling water
Add 1 C ice cubes and mix until they melt
Then pour into the bottom of a 9X13 glass cake pan
Refrigerate until set while mixing other layers
Meanwhile, in a mixing bowl, dissolve lemon jello in ½ C boiling water, and then mix in cream cheese, pineapple, and cool whip
Layer evenly over the cherry jello (once it is well set), and then refrigerate again while making next layer
Meanwhile, dissolve lime jello in 1 C boiling water
Add 1 C ice cubes and mix until ice is melted
Pour over the other 2 layers in the cake pan
Refrigerate until well set, and serve

title: Flan (mom’s recipe)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350
Put milk and cream cheese (cut into cubes) into blender and liquify until smooth
Add 1 C Sugar, eggs, vanilla and salt, and blend until smooth
Cook the other cup of sugar on low heat until caramelized, and pour into the bottom of a 9X9 pan. Pour the blender mixture over the caramelized sugar
Cover with aluminum foil
Put 9X9 pan into a larger pan and pour 1 inch of water in the larger pan surrounding the pan with the flan mixture inside
Bake at 350 for 1 ½ hours
Let cool and then refrigerate for 8 hours before serving

title: Cornstarch Pudding (Grandma Snowbarger’s recipe)
instructions: Mix cornstarch and sugar
Add milk and mix thoroughly
Cook on low heat, stirring constantly, until thickened
Add vanilla, salt and butter, and stir until mixed well
Serve warm or chill and serve

title: Mission Impossible Cookies (easy recipe for kids)
ingredients: Coconut and chopped nuts are optional
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees
Cover 2 cookie sheets each with a layer of graham crackers
Mix butter and brown sugar, and then pour evenly over graham crackers
Add coconut or chopped nuts if you want
Bake for 10 min at 350
Let cool and then break apart

title: Sandies (Mexican Wedding Cookies/Biscochos)
instructions: Preheat oven to 325
Cream butter and vanilla with mixer
Add sugar and continue to mix til light and fluffy
Blend in water
Stir in flour gradually, mixing well (may be too stiff for mixer towards the end)
Add pecans (optional)
Shape into small balls (one inch)
Bake 3 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet
Bake at 325 for 20 min or until bottoms of cookies start to turn golden
Soon after coming out of the oven, carefully roll in powdered sugar and then cool on a plate. Store uncovered.
*you may want to make a double recipe!

title: Cake batter cookies (easy recipe for kids to make)
ingredients: 1 box of any flavor cake mix
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees
Mix all ingredients together
Drop by spoonful onto cookie sheets
Bake 10-12 min at 350

title: Pumpkin Cookies
ingredients: 1 C. cooked and mashed pumpkin (can used canned)
instructions: Preheat oven to 375
Cream sugar and butter with mixer
Add eggs, pumpkin, and vanilla and mix until blended
Mix flour with baking powder and salt and then pour into pumpkin mixture and mix until well blended
Grease cookie sheet and drop cookies by the spoonful onto the cookie sheet
Bake for 10-12 min at 375
Let cool (important!) before icing
Warm frozen orange juice concentrate until it is liquid instead of frozen

To make the icing: Mix orange juice with powdered sugar until it is the consistency of frosting (it will take a LOT more powdered sugar and only a few spoons full of the orange juice to get the right consistency)
Once cookies are fully cooled, ice them with the frosting
*you may want to double this recipe if making for more than your immediate family

title: Gooey Bars
ingredients: 1 C. chopped nuts (pecans or walnuts work well)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350
In 13X9 in glass baking pan (cake pan) melt the butter
Sprinkle graham cracker crumbs evenly over melted butter
Pour condensed milk evenly over crumbs
Top evenly with layers of chocolate chips, coconut and chopped nuts
Press down firmly
Bake for 25 to 30 min or til lightly browned
Cool and then cut into bars
Store loosely covered at room temp

title: Frozen Koloches (Aunt Pauly’s recipe)
instructions: Mix cookie ingredients and roll in 2” rolls
Wrap in wax paper and chill until firm (an hour or two in the fridge or half-hour in freezer)
Meanwhile mix all ingredients together for crème filling and set aside
Take cookies out of the fridge/freezer and cut into ¼ in slices. Then lay out on cookie sheet
Press your thumb in the middle of each cookie to make a well for the crème filling
Fill the middle of each cookie with crème filling
Bake at 375 degrees for 10-12 min
*since these cookies take a while to make, you may want to do a double recipe. They take some time, but they are truly delicious! Like mini cheesecakes!

title: Lemon Bars
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees
Mix 1 egg, butter and cake mix until crumbly and reserve one cup for topping
Pat the remainder of the mixture into the bottom of a lightly greased 9X13 cake pan
Bake for 12-15 min or until lightly browned
Meanwhile, mix in a blender the 2 eggs, sugar, baking powder, salt, lemon peel and lemon juice.
Mix until foamy and then pour over hot crust
Sprinkle on the cup of reserved topping crumbs
Bake 15 more minutes
Sprinkle with powdered sugar if desired
Cool and then cut into bars

title: Crepes
instructions: Beat the eggs with mixer til frothy
Add milk and almond extract and mix in
Add flour, sugar and salt, and beat for 5 min til smooth
Fry in buttered frying pan and tilt pan around batter is a very thin layer.
As soon as you can, gradually lift all the edges with a spatula til you can flip it over with your fingers
Cook for less than a minute per side
Fill with desired fillings (whipped cream, fruit, etc) and roll up like burritos
Add whipped cream on top. Enjoy!

title: Pancakes
ingredients: 2 C. buttermilk (or if you don’t have buttermilk, mix in 2 Tbsp lemon juice with 2 C milk and let sit for 5 min)
instructions: Combine first 5 ingredients (flour, sugar, powder, soda and salt) in large mixing bowl.
Combine last 4 ingredients in separate bowl (eggs, milk, butter and vanilla) and then add all at once to dry ingredients and mix just til moistened
Pour about ¼ C batter onto heated greased frying pan and cook over medium heat for about 2 min per side
For Chocolate Chip Banana Pancakes
After step two, mix in ½ Cup to 1 Cup chocolate chips and 1-2 cut up bananas before cooking pancakes.
For Gluten Free pancakes
Substitute 2 C. Bobs Red Mill Gluten Free 1-1 baking flour for the flour, and then add ½ C. Almond flour in addition. Follow the rest of the recipe as written.

title: French Toast (Overnight - Aunt Grace’s)
ingredients: 2 loafs of French bread, sliced diagonally, ¾ in thick
instructions: On the night before you want to eat the French toast, grease 2 cake pans
Beat eggs
Add milk and vanilla and mix well
Dip slices of bread in egg mixture and layer them in pans
Drizzle honey over the slices and sprinkle cinnamon over them
Cover pans with plastic wrap
Chill overnight
In the morning, take pans out of the fridge and let sit for 30 min
Preheat oven to 350 and then sprinkle brown sugar all over the top and drizzle on melted butter
Bake uncovered for 30 min at 350
Serve with syrup

title: Basic Banana Bread
instructions: Preheat oven to 350
Butter (and sugar if you want) 2 loaf pans or one large cake pan
In large mixing bowl, combine first 6 ingredients (flour, baking power, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt) and make a well in the middle
In a medium bowl, combine the next 6 ingredients (eggs, bananas, sugars, butter and vanilla), and then pour all at once into dry ingredients
Mix just till all ingredients are combined and pour into greased pan
Make streusel topping by mixing brown ¼ c brown sugar and 3 Tbsp butter and then cutting in 2 Tbsp of butter until it is crumbly. Spread on top of pan before baking.
Place pan(s) uncovered in 350 oven for 40-60 min (depending on size of pan) until toothpick in the middle comes out clean
Gluten Free changes:
In step 3, for the 2 Cups of flour, substitute 2 Cups of Bob’s Red Mill Gluten Free 1-1 baking flour
In step 3, add an additional ½ Cup Almond flour
In step 4, add ½ c. Apple Sauce
For Chocolate Chip Banana bread:
In step 5, add ½ Cup to 1 Cup chocolate chips to mixture before pouring into pan

title: Japanese Dinner (Aunt Lenatte’s recipe – Grandma Marilyn’s sister-in-law)
ingredients: 1 large can pineapple (option: warm before serving)
instructions: For sauce, thicken broth with cornstarch by stirring constantly over low heat in small saucepan. Once thick, add can of soup and heat through. Keep warm for serving
Set all the other ingredients out in the listed order and have each person go by, buffet style and put each ingredient in a thin layer on top of each other, sprinkling cheese on last
Pour the sauce over at the end to melt the cheese
Eat!

title: Greek Chicken (Grandpa Maurice’s recipe)
ingredients: 4 chicken breasts or 8-10 chicken tenders (not breaded)
1 can sliced black olives (or kalamata olives), drained
1 pkg feta cheese (6-8 oz), cut in cubes or crumbled
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions
Meanwhile, cook onions (in frying pan) in 1-2 Tbsp olive oil until caramelized
Add chicken and cook, cutting into bite sized pieces once it’s cooked
Add olives and spinach and cover pan to let spinach wilt
Once it starts to wilt, crumble feta cheese over the top and cover again until it melts
Serve over spaghetti noodles

title: Sour Cream Enchiladas
instructions: Preheat oven to 350
Mix sauce ingredients together by hand until smooth
Mix filling ingredients in separate bowl
Grease 2 cake pans with nonstick spray
Cook tortillas (if uncooked) or warm to soften
Place a tortilla on a large plate
Down the center of the tortilla, put a small layer of the sauce, and top with a layer of the filling
Fold over both sides (like a burrito) and lay in the cake pan (you may need to fold over the edges a little bit depending on the size of your pan
Place another layer of sauce on top of it (in the pan)
Repeat steps 5-8 until all tortillas and filling are used up and both pans are full, layering the rolled tortillas side by side, but halfway overlapping
Use any remaining sauce to add to the top of both pans, spreading the sauce over both pans evenly
Sprinkle 1 C grated cheese over the top of both pans
Spray the underside of foil with cooking spray and cover both pans with foil
Bake for 25-30 min at 350 degrees

title: Red Beans and Rice (Grandpa Maurice’s recipe)
ingredients: Tabasco sauce, salt and pepper to taste
instructions: Soak red beans overnight
In the morning, drain water, rinse, put beans in large soup kettle and cover with new water, about 1 inch over the beans
Bring beans to a boil and then add onions and garlic and simmer for an hour on low heat
Add parsley, green onion, tabasco and spices to taste
Add sausage and simmer another 1-2 hours
Take out 1 cup of beans and mash well, then return to the pan and stir in
Cook the rice according to package instructions, and then serve the beans over freshly cooked rice

title: Mom’s Meat Loaf (Grandma Marilyn’s recipe)
ingredients: 1 ½ lb ground beef (or ground turkey)
½ C cracker crumbs (or oatmeal and salt)
instructions: Mix all ingredients until well blended
Make balls out of them (between golf ball and baseball size)
Place in microwaveable dish and cover
Cook until done – 10-15 min – turning around every 5 minutes

*you can also use this recipe for stuffed bell peppers. Just wash and cut the tops off the peppers. Take the insides and seeds out. Then stuff with the meatloaf prior to cooking. Put in the microwave and cook until done!

title: Cook Ranch Special (Mom’s recipe)
ingredients: 1-2 tsp tabasco sauce (depending on how spicy you want it)
instructions: Brown onions and ground beef in large skillet. Drain any grease
Add all other ingredients and simmer 15 min
Serve over rice or mashed potatoes

title: Abuelita’s Mexican rice (mom’s shortcut recipe with instant rice)
ingredients: 3 “cubitos” or tsp of chicken bouillon (or tomato bouillon – or ½ tsp of each)
instructions: Brown rice in frying pan with 1-2 Tbsp Olive oil, stirring constantly over medium heat
Meanwhile, heat water with bouillon and spices (cumin and garlic) in microwave until almost boiling and able to dissolve bouillon
Add onion, and cook with rice until starting to caramelize/brown
Add water with bouillon dissolved in it and stir until mixed
Then add tomato and cilantro to the frying pan with the rice and mix well
Cover and cook for about 10-15 min, until the water is absorbed. Then stir to fluff

title: Mole con Pollo (Abuelita’s recipe)
ingredients: ½ bottle of mole (dona maria brand)
½ of a tablet of Abuelita brand chocolate (for making Mexican hot chocolate)
2-3 cups of white rice, cooked according to package directions
instructions: Cut chicken in pieces and then cook barely covered in boiling water until just cooked.
Remove any white foam that develops on the top.
Meanwhile mix ½ bottle of mole, saltine crackers and ½ tablet of Abuelita chocolate (cut in pieces) in the blender with a cup or so of the boiling broth from the chicken.
Pour the mixture over the chicken and continue cooking on low heat for about an hour
Serve over white rice

title: Chicken and Dumplings (Grandma Marilyn’s recipe)
instructions: Boil chicken, barely covered with water, until done (about an hour) in large covered pot
Add parsley, chopped celery, sliced carrots, chopped onion and salt and continue to simmer
Combine dry dumpling ingredients in one bowl and milk and oil in another bowl
Add wet ingredients to dry and stir JUST until moist
Drop dough by Tablespoon directly onto chicken in boiling stock (don’t let drop too far into the liquid)
Cover tightly, return to boiling and simmer for 12-15 min
Remove dumplings, chicken and veggies
Make gravy by thickening the broth with ½ C flour that has been mixed with1 C cold water prior to pouring in broth. Stir constantly until thickened
Serve chicken and dumplings with gravy to pour over the top

title: Uncle Thaine’s GOOD Chicken
ingredients: 3 tsp Crosse & Blackwell mint sauce (mint flavored vinegar)
instructions: Place Chicken, water, sage and sassafras in saucepan
Cover, bring to boil, and simmer for 20 min
Remove chicken and wrap dill pickles and parsley in each piece
Sprinkle ½ tsp mint sauce over each chicken piece
Serve with rice or potatoes

title: Eggplant Souffle (Grandma Sprenger’s recipe)
instructions: Peel eggplant and cut into ½ in cubes
Cook in very salty water until tender and almost dry
Drain water and mash eggplant well
Preheat oven to 350 and grease large baking pan
Make a white sauce with the butter, flour and milk, and cook while stirring constantly until thickened.
Add eggplant and cheese to white sauce and stir until cheese melts
Add bread cubes, onion, ketchup, salt and pepper as well as the egg yolks (slightly beaten) to the mixture
Beat egg whites with mixer until stiff peaks.
Fold egg whites into eggplant mixture
Pour into large greased baking dish
Bake for 40 min at 350

title: Cheese Souffle (mom’s recipe)
instructions: Preheat oven to 300 degrees
Make white sauce with butter, flour, salt and milk, by mixing together well and cooking over low heat while stirring constantly until it thickens (around 5 min)
Once thickened, add grated cheese and stir until melted. Remove from heat.
In mixing bowl, beat egg whites to stiff peaks
In separate bowl, beat egg yolks until thick and lemon colored. Then gradually add to cheese sauce, while stirring, until well blended.
Gradually fold in egg whites, and then pour into ungreased baking dish (1.5 qt)
Bake for 1 ¼ hours at 300 or until knife inserted off center comes out clean

title: Tomato Pie (mom’s recipe)
instructions: Make dough for crust by combining 3/4C flour, cornmeal, salt and pepper. Then cut in butter until crumbly and add water until it forms into a ball. Refrigerate for half an hour while making filling
Preheat oven to 375
Mix together tomatoes, salt, basil, pepper (to taste), green onion and cheeses
In small bowl, whisk together 2 Tbsp flour, evaporated milk and eggs until smooth
Roll dough our and put in pie plate. Bake for 10 min
Add tomato mixture to pie, and then pour egg mixture over it evenly
Bake for 40 minutes

title: Aunt Jujo’s “Sopita” – Fideo
ingredients: ¼ onion, chopped (can also add 1 clove garlic, minced if you want)
2 “cubitos” or 2tsp of chicken bouillon (or tomato bouillon – or 1 tsp of each)
instructions: Brown fideo in frying pan with 1-2 Tbsp Olive oil, stirring constantly over medium heat
Meanwhile, heat water with bouillon in microwave until almost boiling and able to dissolve bouillon
Add onion, tomato and cilantro to the frying pan with the fideo and mix well
Then add water with bouillon dissolved in it and stir until mixed
Cover and cook for 30 min, stirring occasionally
Serve with lime wedges
*for an entire meal, you can add chicken or cooked ground beef

title: Tostadas (Aunt Adriana’s recipe)
ingredients: salt, pepper, cumin, garlic powder and oregano to season the meat, to taste
queso fresco or another Mexican cheese
1/2 cup olive oil for frying tortillas
instructions: Fry the tortillas in oil, or buy store bought tostadas
Cook the ground beef with the green onion, tomato, and seasonings
Spread refried beans on the fried tortilla,  then add ground beef, cabbage, Mexican cheese, salsa, top with avacado slices and pour Mexican crema on top of tostada

title: Hashbrown Scalloped Potatoes (Karen Walker’s recipe – Grandma Marilyn’s friend from church)
ingredients: 2 lb (or more) diced up boiled potatoes (a panful)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees
Mix all ingredients (except topping) together and pour into large casserole dish (9X12)
Mix melted butter with crushed cornflakes and spread evenly on top of casserole
Bake 45-60 min or until heated through and golden on top

title: Quick Turkey Curry (mom’s recipe)
ingredients: 1 C cubed turkey or chicken (or shredded), cooked
3 C rice (cooked according to pkg directions)
instructions: Cook onion in butter until caramelized in large frying pan
Add soup and milk and cook and stir until smooth
Stir in sour cream and curry and cook and stir until well blended
Add turkey/chicken and heat through
Serve over rice

title: Corn Casserole (Grandma Snowbarger’s recipe)
ingredients: 1 can whole corn (with juice drained off)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350
Melt butter in 8x11 glass cake pan
Mix remaining ingredients together by hand in a mixing bowl
Pour into melted butter
Bake for 30 min at 350 degrees
*for a more “Mexican” flare, substitute a can of mexicorn (the one with diced peppers mixed with the corn) for the whole corn.

title: Spanish Delight (Grandma Snowbarger’s recipe)
ingredients: Chili powder (1-3 tsp depending on level of spice desired)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees
Brown hamburger, onion and bell pepper together, and drain grease
Meanwhile, cook noodles according to pkg directions and drain
Mix together browned meat, cooked noodles, corn, soup, chili powder and salt.
Pour into buttered casserole dish
Top with grated cheese
Bake at 350 for 25 min

title: Hamburger Rice Casserole (Grandma Snowbarger’s recipe)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350
Brown beef with onion and bell pepper in skillet (salt and pepper to taste) and drain grease
Grease 9X13 baking dish and spread rice evenly over the bottom of the dish
Mix can of soup and milk together and pour into meat mixture, and then pour all of that over the rice in the baking dish
Bake 45 min at 350 or until rice is tender
During the last 10 minutes, sprinkle shredded cheese evenly over the dish and cook until melted and bubbly

title: Squash Casserole (Grandma Snowbarger’s recipe)
ingredients: 2 lb yellow squash, washed and sliced
instructions: Preheat oven to 350
Mix melted butter with dressing, saving half of it and layering half of it in the bottom of a long casserole dish
Cook squash, onion and bell pepper until tender in a little salted water
Drain veggies and then mix in soup, water chestnuts and sour cream
Then spread it evenly in casserole dish on top of dressing
Sprinkle the grated cheese evenly over other layers in dish
Top with the last half of the dressing/stuffing
Bake for 30 min at 350

title: Quickie Supper (mom’s recipe)
instructions: Preheat oven to 375
Brown hamburger with onion and salt (pour off any grease)
Add cream cheese, can of soup, milk and ketchup and mix until smooth
Pour into 9X13 baking dish
Bake for 10 min at 375
Take out of the oven and arrange 10 biscuits on the top
Bake 15 min longer
Serve right away!

title: Grean Bean Casserole (Grandma Marilyn’s recipe)
ingredients: 2 pkg(9oz) frozen cut green beans, thawed (or 2 cans French cut green beans, drained)
1 can French fried onions, divided in 2 parts
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees
Combine all ingredients except half the can of French fried onions
Pour into 1 ½ qt baking dish and bake at 350, uncovered, for 30 min
Top with remaining French fried onions and bake 5 min more or until onions are golden

title: Turkey Casserole (Aunt Grace’s recipe for left over turkey from Thanksgiving)
ingredients: 4 cups of shredded turkey (or chicken), already cooked
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees
Mix all ingredients except ritz crackers together in a baking dish
Crumble ritz crackers evenly over the top
Bake for 30 min at 350

title: Broccoli Casserole (Aunt Grace’s recipe)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees
Cook broccoli as directed on package and drain
Combine with all other ingredients, except for cheese crackers in large baking dish
Cover evenly with crushed cheese-its
Bake 45 min at 350

title: Hunnington Chicken (Grandma Snowbarger’s recipe)
ingredients: 1 large chicken, cooked and deboned (you can use the meat from 1 rotisserie chicken)
½ lb (8oz) Velvetta or American Cheese
4 C buttered bread cubes (Cut bread into cubes, and melt 4 Tbsp butter to pour over bread cubes, tossing to cover evenly)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees
Cook shell macaroni per package directions and drain and set aside
Meanwhile, thicken broth with flour (mix together well and cook over medium heat while stirring constantly until thickened)
Add cheese to thickened broth and stir until melted
Add chicken and cooked macaroni and pour into large baking dish
Pour mushroom soup evenly over the top, and then cover the top with the buttered bread cubes
Bake 45 min at 350

title: Bierock Casserole (Mom’s friend, Annie’s recipe)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees
Brown hamburger and onion and drain the grease
Add cabbage and cook for a short time
Mix in mushroom soup and cheese
Press 1 can crescent rolls into the bottom of 9X13 pan
Pour hamburger mixture into pan on top of rolls
Top with the other can of rolls and pinch them together
Bake at 350 for 30 min

title: Egg Nog (Grandma Marilyn’s recipe)
ingredients: 12 C milk (option to make it quicker: warm milk in microwave prior to cooking)
instructions: Use a BIG pot to cook this in
Mix 1 C sugar and 6 egg yolks together well in bottom of big pot
Add salt and milk, and stir over medium heat until it steams (not boils)
In mixing bowl, beat 6 egg whites until foamy
Add 9 Tbsp sugar to egg whites and continue beating until soft peaks form
Fold egg whites into milk mixture gradually
Turn off heat and add vanilla and rum (optional)
Serve with whipped cream and nutmeg on top
Serve warm or refrigerate overnight and serve cold

title: Guacamole (Abuelita’s recipe)
ingredients: 2 Tbsp finely chopped onion (or you can use 2 green onions, finely chopped)
instructions: Wash and then cut avocado in half
Scoop out the insides, with a spoon, discarding the seed
Mash in a medium bowl, with a fork
Finely dice the tomatoes and onion and cilantro, and add to the avocado, mixing well
Squeeze the juice from ½ a lime (to a whole lime if you want it more tart) into the avocado mixture
Add a small shake of garlic powder and a couple shakes of salt (to taste) and mix well
Serve with corn chips

title: Stuffed Mushrooms (Aunt Pauly’s recipe)
ingredients: ¼ C instant rice (or 1/8 C regular rice)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees
Wash mushrooms and dry well
Cut off the very ends of the stems and discard
Take the rest of the stems out of the mushrooms and chop finely
Chop onion and celery finely
Fry mushroom stems, onion and celery in butter or oil in frying pan until caramelized
Mix in Mayo and rice and then stuff all of the mushrooms with the mixture
Place mushrooms on sprayed cookie sheet or baking pan and bake for about 20 minutes (uncovered) at 350 degrees.

title: Cabbage Salad (Grandma Sprenger’s recipe)
ingredients: 1 handful of stuffed green olives, sliced
instructions: Thinly chop cabbage and place in large salad bowl
Add olives
Shake dressing ingredients up in a jar or shaker bottle
Pour over cabbage
Chow down!

title: Broccoflower Salad (Grandma Marilyn’s recipe)
ingredients: 1 head of broccoli, chopped in small pieces
1 head of cauliflower, chopped in small pieces
½ C bacon, cooked and crumbled
instructions: Mix all ingredients (except dressing) in a large salad bowl
Mix dressing ingredients together
Pour over salad and mix together well
Chill before eating

title: Cucumber Salad (Grandma Marilyn’s recipe)
instructions: Peel cucumbers and thinly slice
Sprinkle salt all over cucumbers and then cover in cold water and chill for an hour
Drain water off, but don’t rinse
Mix sugar and vinegar until sugar dissolves, and pour over cucumbers
Chill for another hour or two before serving

title: Chili (Grandma Marilyn’s recipe)
ingredients: 4 cans of beans (pinto, light and dark red kidney, and chili) – don’t drain
instructions: Brown ground beef and onion. Drain grease
Add beef and ALL other ingredients to a big pot and mix well
Bring to boil and then simmer on low for half an hour to an hour
Serve with cornbread or chips

title: Laura Milani’s Tortilla Soup
ingredients: 8 chicken thighs, boiled and shredded (or you can use ALL the meat from 1 whole rotisserie chicken)
instructions: Add ALL ingredients, in order listed, to LARGE soup pot.
Bring to a boil and simmer for at least 40 min to an hour (at least until potatoes are tender
Serve with corn chips, cheese and sour cream if desired (lime juice is also a good addition)

title: Dovi Soup (Zimbabwe)
ingredients: 1 chicken, cooked and shredded or cut into pieces (can use rotisserie chicken)
3-4 tomatoes, chopped, or 1 large can tomatoes
½ lb. fresh spinach (or one pkg frozen spinach)
instructions: Cook Onions with butter in big stew pot until browned.
Add garlic, salt, pepper, and cayenne.
Add Bell peppers and chicken and cook til tender.
Add tomatoes and mash into the pan.
Add 4 cups of water and simmer for 5-10 min
Add peanut butter and chicken broth and simmer for another 10 min
Add spinach and simmer 5 min before serving.

title: Albondigas/Meatball soup (Abuelita’s recipe)
ingredients: 1 lb ground beef, uncooked (defrosted if frozen)
¼  C rice (or ½ C instant rice)
2-3 medium Potatoes, peeled and cut up
instructions: Mix the ground beef, spices (salt, pepper, garlic) and half of the mint with the egg and the rice and form balls (golf ball sized). You should have about 14-16 meatballs when done
In a large frying pan, add olive oil and heat on medium heat
Add tomato, onion and the remaining half of the mint (yerba Buena) leaves and cook for a couple of minutes
Add 3 C water and bring to a boil
Add meatballs (albondigas) and potatoes and cook until potatoes are tender and meatballs are cooked through, about 15-20 min
Serve with lemon slices to squeeze into the soup
*if you double this recipe, you will need to use a soup pan to cook it in instead of a frying pan

title: Tuna Burgers
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees
Mix all ingredients except buns, and then divide evenly among buns
Wrap each bun in foil and place on cookie sheet
Bake for 15-20 min at 350

title: Sloppy Joes (Grandma Marilyn’s recipe)
instructions: Brown hamburger with onion and salt. Drain grease
Mix brown sugar, flour, vinegar and water into a paste
Add ketchup and mustard and cook in saucepan until thickened, stirring constantly
Add sauce to hamburger
Ladle mixture onto hamburger buns and serve
